newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK blue chips close modestly up, H-shares soar.
newsitem.headline: HK blue chips close modestly up, H-shares soar.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks closed modestly higher on Wednesday after trading sideways throughout most of the day as the market took a breather following hefty gains over the previous five sessions, brokers said.
The Hang Seng Index rose 26.57 points, or 0.20 percent, to close at 13,605.91 after see-sawing between 13,533 and 13,649.
"Trading has been kept in a narrow range today," said Ben Kwong, director of research at Dharmala Securities.
But the H-share index set a record closing high of 1,143.43 points, up 32.88 points, or 2.96 percent. Brokers said the China firms benefited from rotational buying as blue chips lost steam.
"Some funds are seen shifting to China enterprises (H-shares) from banking and property stocks," Kwong said.
Blue chips had accumulated gains and now should see some consolidation, he said.
The Hang Seng Index has risen 1,005.49 points or 7.98 percent in the last six sessions.
"A correction is possible but the Hang Seng should see firm support at 13,200," said Tony Yung, research director at Tai Fook Securities Co Ltd.
Brokers said Wednesday's large trading volume showed market momentum remained strong.
Turnover was HK$14.76 billion compared with HK$15.40 billion on Tuesday.
Yung noted some investors sold expensive red chips for H-shares that have lagged behind the recent market rise.
Guangdong Investment eased HK$0.05 to HK$7.10.
Tianjin Bohai led the H-share gainers with a rise of HK$0.19 to HK$1.12.
Jilin Chemical jumped HK$0.15 to HK$1.57. Brokers said the shares were boosted by rumours over a possible asset injection following a group reorganisation.
Late buying pushed up leading blue chip HSBC Holdings by HK$2.00 to an all-time closing high of HK$207.00.
Cheung Kong added HK$0.50 to HK$73.50 and Great Eagle rose HK$0.40 to HK$26.50.

Hong Kong Telecom edged up HK$0.10 to HK$14.20 on buying carried over from Tuesday. Brokers said renewed rumours that a Hong Kong blue chip or China's Ministry of Post and Telecommunications might take a stake in the utility encouraged buyers.
May Hang Seng Index futures were unchanged at 13,620 and June contracts advanced 10 points to 13,660.
